item.description:
As the  Mt. Major hike on April 22 is limited to the number of people who can go I though I would do this hike for anyone who didn't get a chance to go on Sunday but would still like to get a hike in on this weekend. 

 Please note that this is a back entrance into the park off of Route 107 on Reservation Road, Deerfield, NH.  Do not use the front entrance to the park that is on Mountain Road in Nottingham, NH off of Rt 156.  The 3 pictures show where Reservation Road starts on Rt 107.  The third picture shows the mailbox for 137 Raymond Road (Rt 107) which is opposite the start of Reservation Road.

Once you turn onto Reservation Rd. coming off of Route 107 in Deerfield proceed 2.5 miles. At 1.2 miles bear right at the fork, just past the fork the road turns into a dirt road. You will continue on Reservation Rd. till it turns into a private road at a T intersection. At the T intersection Tower Road starts on the left and the private road continues on to the right. Park there.  Look for a white Suzuki Grand Vitara with the license plate 308 0904.

 If you click on the meetup location under the date and then click on get directions in the upper left hand corner and then type in your starting address it will give you directions on how to get to Reservation Rd. in Deerfield. 

  Here are two links to a trail map of the park:

 http://www.nhstateparks.com/Maps/pawhiking.html

http://www.nhstateparks.org/uploads/pdf/PawtuckawayTrailMap_web.pdf

If you click on the link note that Reservation Rd. (back entrance) is shown on the left side of the map and Mountain Rd (front entrance) is on the bottom right of the map.  We will be parking where Tower Road intersects with Reservation Rd. on the map near the number 5.

 Pets are allowed in this park in the off season before Memorial Day.

The elevation gain for this hike is approximately 800 feet.  The elevation gain going to the summit of Middle Mtn. is 350 feet and the elevation gain for South Mtn is 400 feet.   There are a few shorter steep sections on both Mtns.  

We will be checking out Middle Mtn. first.  Once off Middle Mtn. before we start the rest of the hike if anyone was tired at that point and didn't think they could climb South Mtn. there would be a very easy to follow walk on the dirt Tower Road with no turns to worry about to get back to the cars   Just hiking Middle Mtn. would make for an approximately 3.7 mile hike.  If you are doing both peaks this probably could be considered a moderate hike.

There are some views from Middle Mtn. and if you are willing to climb the fire tower there is a 360 degree view from the fire tower on South Mtn. as well as some views from the ground.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Pawtuckaway State Park - 2 Peaks - Middle Mtn. and S. Mtn. Fire Tower - 4.9 mi.
